outdoor_activities.name: Hiking at the Cascades
outdoor_activities.description: The Cascades offers one of the most scenic hikes in the area, with a 66-foot waterfall as the main attraction. The 4-mile round trip hike is moderately challenging and features lush forests, a mountain stream, and serene natural beauty.

outdoor_activities.name: Mountain Biking at Pandapas Pond
outdoor_activities.description: Pandapas Pond is a popular destination for mountain bikers with its well-maintained trails that wind through forests and meadows. The area also has picnic spots and a pond, perfect for a post-ride relaxation.

outdoor_activities.name: Tubing on the New River
outdoor_activities.description: The New River offers fantastic tubing opportunities, with slow-moving waters perfect for beginners and sections of Class I-III rapids for more experienced tubers. The surrounding views of the Appalachian Mountains make it a scenic adventure.

outdoor_activities.name: Hiking McAfee Knob
outdoor_activities.description: McAfee Knob is one of the most iconic hikes on the Appalachian Trail, famous for its panoramic views from the summit. The 8-mile round trip hike offers a challenging ascent, but the views are well worth the effort.

outdoor_activities.name: Fishing at Claytor Lake
outdoor_activities.description: Claytor Lake is a 4,500-acre lake popular for fishing, especially for species like bass, walleye, and catfish. The surrounding state park also offers camping, hiking, and boating opportunities.

outdoor_activities.name: Rock Climbing at Bozoo
outdoor_activities.description: Bozoo is a prime spot for rock climbing enthusiasts, offering a range of climbing routes with varying difficulty levels. Located near the West Virginia border, it’s a hidden gem for climbers seeking adventure in a serene setting.

outdoor_activities.name: Wildlife Watching at Heritage Park
outdoor_activities.description: Heritage Park is a great place for wildlife watching, with open fields, wooded trails, and wetlands that attract a variety of birds and small animals. It’s perfect for a quiet afternoon immersed in nature.

outdoor_activities.name: Hahn Horticulture Garden
outdoor_activities.description: The Hahn Horticulture Garden at Virginia Tech is a six-acre public garden featuring a variety of themed sections like the water and shade gardens, offering beautiful natural scenery. It's a peaceful space for strolls, photography, and outdoor learning, located conveniently on the Blacksburg campus.

outdoor_activities.name: Drillfield
outdoor_activities.description: The Drillfield at Virginia Tech is a large, open grassy area located at the heart of campus, serving as a hub for student activity and a venue for major campus events. It’s a popular spot for recreation, relaxation, and historical significance, symbolizing the connection between Virginia Tech’s military roots and its modern campus life.

outdoor_activities.name: Hiking Dragon’s Tooth
outdoor_activities.description: Dragon’s Tooth is another iconic hike on the Appalachian Trail, known for its rugged rock formations and panoramic views. The 5.7-mile round trip is challenging, especially near the summit, but the views from the top are breathtaking.
